qas.question: Which organization for scientific publications was established in Pakistan in 2002?
How much did the Higher Education Commission impact the number of PhDs in Pakistan?
How many universities were in Pakistan in 2001?
What science university did Saudi Arabia establish?

answers.text: King Abdullah University of Science and Technology

qas.question: When did Turkey establish the Higher Education Commission?
What type of publication does Pakistan have a signifigant amount of?
By how much has Iran increased its PhDs?
By how much has Iran increased its number of research papers?

plausible_answers.text: Zayed University, United Arab Emirates University, and Masdar Institute of Science and Technology

qas.question: What university has the United Arab Emirates established?

context: Several Muslim countries like Turkey and Iran exhibit high <b6_0>scientific publication<b6_0/>. Some countries have tried to encourage scientific research. In Pakistan, establishment of the <a0_0>Higher Education Commission<a0_0/> in <b5_0>2002,<b5_0/> resulted in a <a1_0><b7_0>5-fold increase<b7_0/><a1_0/> in the number of PhDs and a <b8_0>10-fold<b8_0/> increase in the number of scientific research papers in 10 years with the total number of universities increasing from <a2_0>115<a2_0/> in 2001 to over 400 in 2012.[citation needed] Saudi Arabia has established the <a3_0>King Abdullah University of Science and Technology<a3_0/>. <a4_0>United Arab Emirates<a4_0/> has invested in <b9_0>Zayed University, United Arab Emirates University, and Masdar Institute of Science and Technology<b9_0/>[clarification needed]
